page.title: 04WASHINGTON WILDFOWL PARK
page.content: It was opened in 1975 and covers 100 acres. It enables people to see tame and wild water birds from all over the world. It has:- 1.Gatehouse. 7.Reservoir Pools 2.Bird Collection 8.Play areas 3.Wader lake 9.Education Pools 4.Sandpiper pond 10.Rainshelter/Hides 5.Reedbeds 11.Main lake & Hide 6.Hawthorn wood 12.Winter path/wood. The Gatehouse is a Scandinavian type of wooden building. Inside is a large window in front of which all the birds are fed twice a day. Visitors can feed the birds by hand. There is a swan support and a duck adoption scheme.For Â£7.50 a year you receive a seasonal report on "your" swan and for a duck the cost is Â£4. There is a 1 in 5 chance of hearing about it again after ringing.
